qas.question: What is the name of the elevator attraction at the Disney World parks across the world?

answers.text: The Twilight Zone Tower of Terror

qas.question: What is the main feature of this attraction?

answers.text: a simulated free-fall achieved through the use of a high-speed elevator system

qas.question: Do ride goers stand or sit?

answers.text: passengers are seated and secured in their seats rather than standing

qas.question: What unique feature does this ride provide guests?

answers.text: downward acceleration greater than that of normal gravity

qas.question: What type of motor is used?

context: <a0_0>The Twilight Zone Tower of Terror<a0_0/> is the common name for a series of elevator attractions at the Disney's Hollywood Studios park in Orlando, the Disney California Adventure Park park in Anaheim, the Walt Disney Studios Park in Paris and the Tokyo DisneySea park in Tokyo. The central element of this attraction is <a1_0>a simulated free-fall achieved through the use of a high-speed elevator system<a1_0/>. For safety reasons, <a2_0>passengers are seated and secured in their seats rather than standing<a2_0/>. Unlike most traction elevators, the elevator car and counterweight are joined using a rail system in a continuous loop running through both the top and the bottom of the drop shaft. This allows the drive motor to pull down on the elevator car from underneath, resulting in <a3_0>downward acceleration greater than that of normal gravity<a3_0/>. The <a4_0>high-speed drive motor<a4_0/> is used to rapidly lift the elevator as well.
